Job Title:
new post Hybrid Digital Designer - Mon - Fri 9am-5pm
- job post
Job Description:
Williams Lea is hiring for a Hybrid Digital Designer for our Columbus, OH office to work Monday to Friday 9:00 am to 5:00 pm!
Pay: $35.00 hourly
Benefits:
  • Various health insurance options & wellness plans (Medical, Dental, Vision, Prescription Drug)
  • 401k Retirement Savings Plan Including Employer Match
  • Paid Time Off (PTO)
  • Life Insurance
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Short-term & Long-term Disability
  • Healthcare & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts
  • Domestic Partner Coverage
  • Commuter Benefits
  • Legal Assistance
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Additional Employee Perks and Discounts
The Digital Designer will play a crucial role on the digital team, responsible for leading the end-to-end design process from concept to completion. This role is ideal for a hands-on designer with a deep understanding of digital best-practices, responsive design, an unquestionably keen eye, and a mastery of design software. The ideal candidate will be a collaborative creative thinker, detail-oriented self-starter, and possess exceptional visual design skill for digital media. This position requires high attention to detail with a passion to push the envelope in smart and creative ways.
Job qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Digital Arts/Graphic Design (or related field) or equivalent years of experience
  • 5-7 years of relevant work experience in the digital design industry. Experience working at/with tech companies, ad agencies, brand consultancies, strategic marketing agencies, and/or product design firms
  • Highly skilled in Adobe Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator), Sketch, Final Cut Pro, After Effects. Maya and/or 3D Studio Max a plus.
  • Familiarity with current UX and prototyping tools
  • Experience in content creation and UX principals (guiding teams with directional copy and design flow)
  • Ability to storyboard, comp visual ideas, and create light creative copy
  • Advanced conceptual creative and production skills with a strong understanding of layout principles, aesthetic design concepts and typography
  • Proven experience creating campaigns and extending the look and feel through various marketing materials
  • Able to complete tasks within tight schedules and under strict layout controls
  • Knowledge and advocacy of user-centered digital design principles
  • Strong presentation skills
  • Works well in a team environment
  • Works quickly under pressure and turn around designs on tight deadlines
  • Responsive design experience
  • An exceptional online portfolio showcasing interactive design that demonstrates refined use of typography, layout, unique visual language development, and an understanding of usability principles
Job duties
    • Conceptualize and produce digital collateral for marketing and sales, including original campaigns, OLA, EDM, Websites, applications, and motion graphics
    • Conceptualize and produce storyboards to provide clear and concise direction for animation
    • Produce motion graphics to exacting detail provided by a brief and/or storyboard
    • Formulate forward-thinking concepts and render designs for digital media and solutions while always elevating our client’s brand
    • Identify fresh and innovative design solutions that push the boundaries of the client brand and explore more effective formats and/or media channels
    • Provide original and effective visual solutions by leading the execution of client creative requests and creative projects
    • Provide creative input for digital projects both internally and externally
    • Sketch and wireframe digital experiences
    • Create user flows, sitemaps and other communication artifacts
  • Develop simple interactive prototypes
  • Communicate and articulate design rationales
  • Work closely with developers to build functional prototypes quickly, thus a strong knowledge of how design and technology work together is a must
It is the policy of Williams Lea to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity of expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law.
Williams Lea is a drug-free workplace and performs pre-employment substance abuse testing.

Job Title:
new post Senior Experience Designer
- job post
Job Description:
You have a life. We like that about you.
At OCLC, we believe you'll do the best work of your life when you're living the best life possible.
We work hard to build the technology that connects thousands of today's libraries. But we also work hard to make a job at OCLC a meaningful part of a balanced life- not a substitute for one.
Technology with a Purpose. OCLC supports thousands of libraries in making information more accessible and more useful to people around the world. OCLC provides shared technology services, original research and community programs that help libraries meet the ever-evolving needs of their users, institutions, and communities. With office locations around the globe, OCLC employees are dedicated to offering premier services and software to help libraries.
The Job Details are as follows:
The Senior Experience Designer provides user-centered interaction and visual design methodology to improve the usability, ease of use, and enhance appeal, and maximize functionality provided through the interaction between the customer and a product or service, addressing all aspects of a product or service as perceived by users.

This Senior Experience Designer is a part of a midsized, maturing UXD team made up of research and design associates. Each member or small team is aligned to a single OCLC product.
Who You Are:
  • Proactive, self-motivated, positive, curious, detailed, passion for the user
  • Big picture, forward thinker
  • Excels at communication, presenting ideas and other soft skills
  • Able to speak to your design decisions and answer the "why"
  • Doesn't hesitate to use a dry-erase markers when the time is right
  • Experience designing with established and evolving pattern library. Think in systems.
  • Explore different way to solve problems while identifying pros and cons, questions and/or implications
  • Highly competent using Figma and Miro software
  • High proficiency creating UX deliverables such as wireframes, user flows, user journeys, sitemaps, personas, high fidelity designs, Figma prototypes, etc.
  • Working knowledge of responsive design and related best practices
  • Keeps current with design trends and best practices
  • Comfortable working both remote and onsite
  • Comfortable engaging with internal and external customers, reflecting OCLC values
  • Have experience moderating user testing
  • Ability to design for accessibility, familiarity with WCAG 2.x
  • Experience running ideation sessions
What You'll Do:
  • Connect key groups of people, Research, Experience, Business teams to deliver the work and socialize it
  • Create detailed UI designs with accessibility in mind and collaborate with engineers to bring it to life.
  • Collaborate with UXD researcher on research plan, stakeholder interviews, user interviews, etc.
  • Conduct and moderate usability testing for your assigned projects
  • Run workshop and ideation sessions with key stakeholders
  • Work through design problems from concept to launch translating research insights into ideas that form disruptive new products and features
  • Design workflows and detailed interactive prototype to communicate the idea to stakeholders.
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience in responsive design, visual design or related field.
  • 5+ years of experience with responsive design and related best practices as well as with designing enterprise web applications.
  • 5+ years of experience creating UX deliverables such as wireframes, user flows, user journeys, sitemaps, personas, high fidelity designs, Figma prototypes, etc.
  • Highly competent using Figma, Miro, Microsoft office software.
Working Conditions: Normal office environment.
ADA/EAA: The above statements cover what are generally believed to be principal and essential functions of this job. Specific circumstances may allow or require some people assigned to the job to perform a somewhat different combination of duties.

Job Title:
new post Director UX Design
- job post
Job Description:
Does this position interest you? You should apply – even if you don’t match every single requirement! We're known as an auto glass company. That's the focus of what we do. But beyond the glass, we're so much more. We'll help you build a fulfilling career and encourage you to have a life. Let us be the best place you'll ever work.
Does this position interest you? You should apply – even if you don’t match every single requirement! We're known as an auto glass company. That's the focus of what we do. But beyond the glass, we're so much more. We'll help you build a fulfilling career and encourage you to have a life. Let us be the best place you'll ever work.

A Brief Overview
The User Experience (UX) Design Director will play a key role in developing and implementing the vision, strategy and team needed to serve our customers digitally. They will lead the design exploration and innovation of our digital applications and websites, direct and mentor a team of UX designers, champion our user-centered design process, and build strong relationships with internal team members including Research, Brand, Product, Custom Communications, and Development. This role will require familiarity and understanding of research, design, and development processes including user testing, building prototypes, and sprint-based design.

What you will do
  • Directs and develops the strategy behind user experience efforts translates strategy into user experience objectives. Communicates designs and objectives with UI leadership team.
  • Provides oversight in the development of user experience framework(s) that define the product value proposition to support product and services roadmap investments.
  • Collaborates with Product Mangers and other cross-functional leaders to define, prioritize and implement strategic user experience design needs. Confidently presents recommendations to top levels of management to influence adoption of best-in-class digital designs.
  • Manages Safelite's design system documentation and component library. Ensures document is updated as needed and is accessible to Safelite associates.
  • Partners with Traffic Supervisor to manage project intake and assign workload to the team.
  • Manage, lead, and mentor UX Design team members. Ensure routine responsibilities are performed and priorities are aligned with business goals.

Education Qualifications
  • Bachelor's Degree Human Factors, UX Design, Communication Design or related field Required
Experience Qualifications
  • 10+ years Related experience Required
  • User Experience or user interface design for digital products, or related work experience Required
  • Experience managing UX Design team Required
Skills and Abilities
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills including ability to present, interact with and influence all levels of management, internally and externally (High proficiency)
  • Strong knowledge of user-centered design methodologies and best practices, including usability testing and user journey mapping (High proficiency)
  • Familiar with platforms such as Webflow, Lookback, Maze, Wrike (Low proficiency)
  • Strong experience using Figma, Miro, Adobe applications (High proficiency)
  • Ability to work effectively in an Agile environment, including the ability to adapt quickly and effectively to changing requirements (High proficiency)
  • Proficient in Microsoft products such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc (Medium proficiency)
Our people are passionate about what they do, the product they sell, and the customers they serve. If you're looking for an opportunity to be a part of a work family that values collaboration, innovation and dedication, we're the right company for you.

Job Title:
new post Senior Software Engineer, UX Designer Applications - Remote National
- job post
Job Description:
Extraordinary Care. Extraordinary Careers.

With the nation’s largest home infusion provider, there is no limit to the growth of your career.

Option Care Health, Inc. is the largest independent home and alternate site infusion services provider in the United States. With over 6,000 team members including 2,900 clinicians, we work compassionately to elevate standards of care for patients with acute and chronic conditions in all 50 states. Through our clinical leadership, expertise and national scale, Option Care Health is re-imagining the infusion care experience for patients, customers and employees.

As a proud recipient of the Gallup Exceptional Workplace Award, we recognize that part of being extraordinary is supporting and building a workforce that is as diverse as the patients and communities we serve.
Join a company that is taking action to develop a culture that is more inclusive, respectful, engaging and rewarding for all team members. We are committed to hiring, developing, and retaining a diverse workforce.

Job Description Summary:

Responsible for designing software applications that help the functionality of new and existing company products. Should be a skilled and motivated Senior UX/UI Designer to join our team, collaborating closely with Architects, developers, and stakeholders to enhance our UI design practice.

Job Description:

Job Responsibilities (listed in order of importance and/or time spent)

  • Creates / reviews detailed designs and specifications, and participate in developing project estimates, schedule, and commitments.
  • Provides recommendations regarding platform construction and purchasing of products to support complex or corporate business needs. Works with a solution architecture for high-level design
  • Developing, maintaining internal UX processes to adapt to evolving user and business needs
  • Maintain all UX/IA Templates, documentation, assets, personas, design mockups, user flows, navigational maps and experience documentation for assigned projects
  • Develops / creates / modifies application code on processes that have moderate effect on business operations, or significant effect on processes specific to a particular department
  • Performs the more complex detailed design/code/test quality reviews for components.
  • Performs mitigation and resolution activities for critical production failures
  • Plans and executes implementation; oversee implementation of moderate to complex application into production.
  • Championing the customer needs, making realizable, innovative and cross-device recommendations & solutions for improving the experience
  • Interfaces with clients to clarify requirements, researches problems, answers less routine questions, and develops solutions to problems. Escalates as required
  • Researches, identifies and recommends technical and operational improvements resulting in improved reliability and/or efficiencies in maintaining and/or developing the application.
  • Evaluates technical aspects of open work requests with Project manager.
  • Understand technical and business constraints and scale designs for iterative release, ensuring user needs are met in each iteration

Supervisory Responsibilities

Does this position have supervisory responsibilities? No

Basic Education and/or Experience Requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree and 5-7 years of experience in application development and maintenance.
  • At least 5+ years of relevant experience in software UI design.
  • At least 5+ years of experience with developing and design
  • At least 5+ years working with HTML5, XHTML, DHTML, CSS3, XML and JavaScript

Basic Qualifications

  • Knowledge of technical design process and models.
  • Works independently and in collaboration with UX management and designers to produce multiple concepts and prototypes for internal use, usability testing, and customer review
  • Produces multiple concepts and prototypes for internal use, usability testing and presentation to customers, working independently and in collaboration with UX management and designers.
  • Experience with SDLC / SW development processes (RUP, Agile, Waterfall)
  • Experience using analytical skills, tools and techniques to investigate information and to draw conclusions.
  • Strong systems thinking, UX concepting and wireframing capabilities, UI architecture and feature scoping skills
  • Languages: Understanding of HTML; CSS; JavaScript;XML
  • Working knowledge of a UX process end-to-end
  • Excellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction
  • The willingness to step up when your team depends on it

Physical Demand Requirements

  • Better if we can get resource at Cleveland Ohio.

Travel Requirements: (if required)

  • None

Preferred Qualifications & Interests (PQIs)

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science OR Master’s Degree in IT or Computer Science

Due to some state pay transparency laws, below is the minimum pay for the position:

Salary to be determined by the applicant's education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity and alignment with market data.

Minimum pay is $77,637.25+

Benefits:

  • 401k
  • Dental Insurance
  • Disability Insurance
  • Health Insurance
  • Life Insurance
  • Paid Time off
  • Vision Insurance

Job Title:
new post User Experience (UX) Architect
- job post
Job Description:
Company Description


CapTech is an award-winning consulting firm that collaborates with clients to achieve what’s possible through the power of technology. At CapTech, we’re passionate about the work we do and the results we achieve for our clients. From the outset, our founders shared a collective passion to create a consultancy centered on strong relationships that would stand the test of time. Today we work alongside clients that include Fortune 100 companies, mid-sized enterprises, and government agencies, a list that spans across the country.


Job Description


CapTech’s Customer Experience (CX) team seeks a UX Architect with a track record of designing sophisticated, intuitive, and impactful digital brand experiences that are informed by qualitative and quantitative user research and accessibility best practices.


Our UX Architects are passionate problem-solvers who strive to ensure alignment between user goals, behaviors, and attitudes with business objectives, while honing their craft and growing in their careers. They stay current with the latest research tools and methods for understanding user behavior, and they approach additional training in these areas with curiosity and enthusiasm. In addition, our UX Architects mentor other practitioners, overseeing their work to ensure successful delivery.


This could be the position for you if:

  • You possess strong conceptual and visual communication skills, have expert knowledge of interaction design and usability principles, and can span multiple projects.
  • You have a proven understanding of user research and usability testing methodologies, with strong analytic capabilities necessary to provide insights and recommendations.
  • You have a proven understanding of product strategy, heuristic analysis, information architecture, user research, user interface and interaction design, wireframing, prototyping, and usability testing.
  • You are a confident self-starter, yet able to take feedback from clients and direction from UX and Creative Directors with humility, all while collaborating closely with project teams.
  • You thrive in an environment that requires strong problem-solving skills and enjoy collaborating with other interaction designers, user researchers, developers, and business system analysts.

Responsibilities may include:

  • Leading the creation of personas, customer journeys, conceptual prototypes, and responsive interfaces that follow interaction design and usability best practices.
  • Leading advanced design activities such as design workshops, rapid prototyping, and iterative user testing.
  • Producing clean, informative, and concise presentations to clients and internal teams that communicate the rationale behind your designs and recommendations.
  • Advocating the benefits of accessible design and usability with clients and team members.
  • Giving insightful and constructive feedback on the designs, including interactions, information architecture, content, and alignment with business goals and user needs.
  • Performing competitive assessments and providing innovative alternatives, as well as researching and understanding design and technology trends.
  • Comfort discussing scope and level of effort (LOE) with senior practice area and account team members.
  • Volunteering for CX leadership opportunities, including contributing to methodologies, capabilities, approaches, and toolset. Attending and leading CX meetings and trainings. Engages in professional development and industry involvement.
  • Proactively seeking to mentor others about design. Providing design oversight and art direction for visual and interaction designers.

Qualifications
  • 5+ years professional experience, ideally in a consulting or agency context.
  • 4-year+ degree in design, fine arts, or similar preferred.
  • Proven written, verbal, conceptual, and visual communication skills.
  • Experience with multiple domains of human-centered design including user and market research, product and experience strategy, information architecture, experience design, content strategy, optimization, and customer insight.
  • Figma expertise is preferred, with proficiency in comparable design tools (Sketch, Adobe XD). Proficiency with Illustrator, Photoshop, and InDesign, as well as PowerPoint.
  • Working knowledge of Agile product development lifecycles and practices is a plus.
  • Familiarity with WCAG and other accessibility guidelines and standards is a plus.


Please include a link to your online portfolio with your application in order to be considered.


Additional Information


We want everyone at CapTech to be able to envision a lasting and rewarding career here, which is why we offer a variety of career paths based on your skills and passions. You decide where and how you want to develop, and we help get you there with customizable career progression and a comprehensive benefits package to support you along the way. Alongside our suite of traditional benefits encompassing generous PTO, health coverage, disability insurance, paid family leave and more, we’ve launched extended benefits to help meet our employees’ needs.

  • CapFlex – Employee-first mentality that supports a remote and hybrid workforce and empowers daily flexibility while servicing our clients
  • Learning & Development – Programs offering certification and tuition support, digital on-demand learning courses, mentorship, and skill development paths
  • Modern Health –A mental health and well-being platform that provides 1:1 care, group support sessions, and self-serve resources to support employees and their families through life’s ups and downs
  • Carrot Fertility –Inclusive fertility and family-forming coverage for all paths to parenthood – including adoption, surrogacy, fertility treatments, pregnancy, and more – and opportunities for employer-sponsored funds to help pay for care
  • Fringe –A company paid stipend program for personalized lifestyle benefits, allowing employees to choose benefits that matter most to them – ranging from vendors like Netflix, Spotify, and GrubHub to services like student loan repayment, travel, fitness, and more
  • Employee Resource Groups – Employee-led committees that embrace and incorporate diversity and inclusion into our day-to-day operations
  • Philanthropic Partnerships – Opportunities to engage in partnerships and pro-bono projects that support our communities.
  • 401(k) Matching – Generous matching and no vesting period to help you continue to build financial wellness

CapTech is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a culture of equality, inclusion and fairness — each foundational to our core values. We strive to create a diverse environment where each employee is encouraged to bring their unique ideas, backgrounds and experiences to the workplace. For more information about our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging efforts, click HERE. As part of this commitment, CapTech will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact Laura Massa directly via email lmassa@captechconsulting.com.

At this time, CapTech cannot transfer nor sponsor a work visa for this position. Applicants must be authorized to work directly for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship.

Job Title:
new post UI/UX Designer
- job post
Job Description:
LOCATION: Columbus, Ohio

POSITION TYPE: ASAP – 06/30/2024

POSITION TERM: The candidate will be required report on-site to pick up equipment on first day and be available to work on-site as requested

Current Ohio Residents will only be considered.

Interviews will be required to be in-person

Client is seeking a UI/UX Designer with expertise in designing and prototyping desktop and mobile application – will work with CIMS 2.0 project team to design/develop user interface.

The selected Consultant will be directly responsible for designing a modern and intuitive UI/UX and should have direct experience interacting with business users to create the UI/UX. They will work closely with the designated Business Users, IT supervisor, project managers, and other developers in an agile development environment.

Will be responsible for design/develop user interface using Prototyping Designer tools. The new applications will implement an N-tier architecture and comply with ODPS coding standards.

Work on various stages of the product development process from discovery to research to design user interface.
Participate in meetings with stakeholders, business users, and engineering teams to understand and project UI requirements.
Work with project managers, developers, and business analysts to brainstorm ideas, approaches, and design solutions.
Create wireframes, prototypes, and user-friendly designs that support complex business processes.
Test and iterate various product concepts with users; conduct user research and analysis to validate the design.

SKILLS:
Experience in taking UI requirements and using them to design graphical interfaces in applications Required 8

Experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (JavaScript frameworks also acceptable) Required 8

Advanced understanding of site architecture and designing intuitive UIs and navigations. Required

Experience with Designer tools – Adobe XD, Figma, Sketch or similar tool. Required 3

Experience designing and delivering products from start to finish as part of a cross-functional team. Required 5

Job Title:
new post Content Designer
- job post
Job Description:
We’re looking for a Senior Content Designer to help plan, create, and manage product content to support a 9-12 month customer migration program. You’ll work with a fast-past and focused, multi-disciplinary team, including product, design, engineering, and legal, that’s committed to help customers successfully onboard their existing accounts to Client.

Job Responsibilities

  • Deliver content components (UI language, product education, accessibility content etc.) that’s on-brand and meets our legal and editorial standards
  • Contribute to the structural design of product experience (navigation, labeling, flow)
  • Lead adherence in content governance and approvals process
  • Use and actively contribute to content systems (standards, voice and tone, messaging, and accessibility libraries)

Required Qualifications, Capabilities and Skills

  • Bachelor’s Degree in relevant discipline (e.g., Interaction Design, HCI, English, Rhetoric), certification from credible bootcamp or similar accelerated learning program, or equivalent work experience
  • Self-directed in both planning and structuring your effort, and executing and expected levels of quality; you don’t need someone guiding you through the work
  • Prior work involves collaboration within design teams (with other Product Designers, UX Researchers, and Content Designers) and cross-functionally with Product Managers, and Software Engineers
  • Advanced skills in UX Writing and Information Architecture; Intermediate ability in adjacent skills such as User Research, Interaction Design, and Visual UI Design
  • Thorough knowledge of English language, grammar, spelling, punctuation, and usage
  • Experience working with brand and copy standards, including style, voice and tone
  • Comfortable and confident when presenting work to cross-functional Directors

Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities and Skills

  • Advocate for Accessibility Guidelines and Inclusive Design practices
  • Demonstrated experience with user-centered and human-centered design approaches
  • Familiarity with the organizational navigation required for content compliance, including legal and accessibility reviews
  • Demonstrated understanding of how design connects with broader business value

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $20.00 - $30.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Columbus, OH 43207: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

Job Title:
new post Graphic Designer
- job post
Job Description:
Graphic Designer

Craft Health is dedicated to our mission of creating a revolution in health care by providing access to services that focus on early detection and prevention, empowering patients, and saving lives. With our growing network of clinics and patient services, we are seeking an talented and creative Graphic Designer, as we continue to grow our national footprint.

Working here

Our team is passionate, talented, and driven by our purpose to improve the health and happiness of our members and local communities. Our culture empowers each employee to do what’s needed to create value for our customers and our company while also enjoying their experience at work. Craft Health has been selected as a Certified Top Workplace to Work for the last two years, and we are just getting started!

Opportunity

We are seeking a talented and creative Graphic Designer to join our team. This position will play a crucial role in conceptualizing and creating visual assets that effectively communicate our brand's message and engage our target audience. The ideal candidate should have a strong portfolio showcasing a range of design skills across various mediums. At Craft Health, we value creativity, innovation, and a passion for design.

Join our team and contribute to visually shaping our brand's narrative and impact!

Responsibilities

Conceptualization and Design:

· Develop creative concepts and ideas for visual communication in collaboration with the marketing team.

· Design and produce a wide range of materials such as digital graphics, print collateral, advertisements, social media content, presentations, and more.

· Translate complex ideas and messages into visually appealing and easily understandable designs.

Branding and Identity:

· Ensure consistency and adherence to brand guidelines across all design projects.

· Contribute to the evolution and development of the brand's visual identity, including logos, color palettes, typography, and overall design aesthetic.

Digital Design:

· Create eye-catching and user-friendly designs for websites, mobile apps, and other digital platforms.

· Optimize graphics for online use, considering responsive design principles and ensuring fast loading times.

Print Design:

· Design various print materials such as brochures, flyers, posters, banners, and packaging.

· Prepare files for print production, including selecting appropriate formats, resolutions, and color profiles.

Illustration and Iconography:

· Develop custom illustrations and iconography that align with the brand's visual language.

· Create visual representations of concepts, data, or processes as needed.

Collaboration and Communication:

· Work closely with cross-functional teams including marketing, sales, and business development teams to understand design requirements and project goals.

· Effectively communicate design concepts and rationale to team members and stakeholders.

Trends and Innovation:

· Stay up-to-date with industry trends, emerging design techniques, and technologies to bring fresh and innovative ideas to the team.

Qualifications

· Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Graphic Design, Visual Communication, or related field.

· Proven experience as a Graphic Designer with a strong portfolio showcasing a range of design work.

· Proficiency in industry-standard design software such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) and other relevant tools.

· Strong understanding of design principles, typography, color theory, and layout techniques.

· Familiarity with digital design best practices, UI/UX principles, and responsive design.

· Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

· Excellent communication skills and the ability to present and explain design concepts.

· Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work.

Please Note: Interested candidates are requested to submit their resume and portfolio.

Job Type: Full-time

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

  • 401(k) matching
  • Dental insurance
  • Employee discount
  • Health insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Parental leave

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

  • Bonus opportunities

Work Location: In person

Job Title:
new post UI/UX Designer
- job post
Job Description:
Position: UI/UX Designer

Location: Columbus, OH - Onsite

Duration: 10+ months contract

Pay Rate: $55/hr. on C2C

Description:

DPS is seeking a UI/UX Designer with expertise in designing and prototyping desktop and mobile application - will work with CIMS 2.0 project team to design/develop user interface.

The selected Consultant will be directly responsible for designing a modern and intuitive UI/UX and should have direct experience interacting with business users to create the UI/UX. They will work closely with the designated Business Users, IT supervisor, project managers, and other developers in an agile development environment.

The Consultant, in working with ODPS staff, will be responsible for design/develop user interface using Prototyping Designer tools. The new applications will implement an N-tier architecture and comply with ODPS coding standards.

During the interview process with the ODPS staff, the resource consultant must demonstrate competence/experience in their specific area(s) of project assignment. The resource consultant must also present or share their portfolio with samples. The resource’s experience must also be documented for review and verification. Offered resources not showing technical or functional competence/experience will be sufficient reason to reject the Offeror’s proposal. It is the responsibility of the Offeror to pre-screen their candidates to ensure compliance. Resources will have a background check conducted by ODPS.

Mandatory Skills/Experience:

8 Years of verifiable experience in taking user interface requirements and using them to design graphical interfaces in applications.

8 years exp with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (JavaScript frameworks also acceptable)

Advanced understanding of site architecture and designing intuitive user interfaces and navigations.

3 years exp with Designer tools. Adobe XD, Figma, Sketch or a similar tool. An ability to quickly learn new tools as they emerge.

5 years of experience designing and delivering products from start to finish as part of a cross-functional team.

Exposure to ASP.NET C–Sharp (C#) language.

A demonstrable understanding of implementing secure UI design and coding practices for an ASP.NET MVC application.

8 years of experience developing a project within the AGILE methodology.

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $50.00 - $55.00 per hour

Compensation package:

  • Hourly pay

Experience level:

  • 10 years

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Columbus, OH 43223: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Application Question(s):

  • Expereicne with ASP.NET C–Sharp (C#) language
  • 3 years exp with Designer tools. Adobe XD, Figma, Sketch or a similar tool

Experience:

  • UI/UX: 8 years (Required)
  • HTML, CSS and JavaScript: 8 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

Job Title:
new post Senior Conversion Designer - UI/UX
- job post
Job Description:
The Opportunity
Seamless.AI is seeking an experienced and data-driven Senior Conversion Designer -UI/UX, to join our dynamic marketing team. The Senior Conversion Designer will be instrumental in driving growth by optimizing the UI, UX, and conversion rates at each stage of the customer lifecycle, including our website, web app, paid media campaigns, and other digital touchpoints. This position reports directly to the VP of Marketing and will play a critical role in shaping our customer acquisition strategies.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop, implement, and design a comprehensive conversion rate optimization strategy to drive growth across our web pages and the customer lifecycle.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including product, sales, and content to optimize the user experience and ensure alignment with broader company objectives.
  • Use a data-driven approach to analyze and improve the website, landing pages, and paid media performance metrics.
  • Create custom animations to support product education and conversion rates
  • Create detailed dashboards for tracking the performance of conversion strategies.
  • Optimize webpage design, UX / UI, etc. to maximize conversions by evaluating strategies to improve conversion rates, cost per conversion, and return on investment.
  • Continually assess competitor strategies and industry trends to identify opportunities for conversion rate improvements.
  • Drive conversion rate growth by testing and optimizing messaging, user flows, landing pages, and other digital touchpoints.

Skillset:

  • 8+ years of experience in conversion rate optimization, HTML/CSS, UI and Front End Development
  • Advanced experience in Adobe Illustrator, Adobe After Effects, and Photoshop
  • Strong analytical skills with proficiency in web analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Amplitude, FullStory, Hotjar etc.
  • Experience with A/B and multivariate testing tools such as Optimizely, VWO, Google Optimize, or similar.
  • Demonstrated experience in optimizing conversion rates for websites, landing pages, and paid media campaigns directly tied to business outcomes.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.
  • Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Experience working at a high-transaction SaaS company

Check out what our employees think about working at Seamless: CLICK HERE

Seamless.AI has been delivering the world's best sales leads since 2015. Our product is the first real time, B2B search engine helping sales teams maximize revenue, increase sales, and easily acquire their total addressable market using artificial intelligence. We have been recognized as one of Ohio's fastest growing companies and won 2020 Best Places to Work, LinkedIn's Top 50 Tech Startups in 2020 and 2022, and Purpose Jobs 2023 Best Workplace Culture and Best Work-life balance. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Visa Sponsorship is not included in our hiring package. Applicants will need to be authorized to work in the U.S.

Job Title:
new post UX Designer
- job post
Job Description:
Here at Lower, we believe homeownership is the greatest wealth creator in America today. We also know the path to get there can be daunting; but it doesn't need to be.

As a mission-driven fintech, everything we do revolves around simplifying the home buying process. Through our growing family of companies and products, our team meets customers where they want to do business at every step of the journey.

Lower has originated, underwritten, and funded tens of billions of dollars in home loans and offers an industry-leading customer experience with ratings of 4.8 on Trustpilot, 4.9 on Google, and 4.9 on Zillow.

What you'll do:

You'll work closely with product managers, engineers, and marketers to deliver a best-in-class user experience that exceeds our customers' expectations and earns their trust and loyalty. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Understanding - and empathizing with - our customers by synthesizing quantitative and qualitative data (customer interviews, surveys, and so forth).
  • Working with key partners to identify user problems and design thoughtful solutions that deliver moments of delight.
  • Producing wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity visual designs across multiple resolution formats that are mindful of technical constraints and implementation cost.

Who you are:

  • 3+ years of professional experience as a UX designer.
  • You're an excellent problem-solver that can develop practical solutions.
  • You're an effective communicator with any audience - product managers, engineers, business stakeholders, senior management, and so forth.
  • You have experience conducting user interviews, usability tests, and other types of research.
  • You're proficient with industry standard design tools (Figma preferred).
  • Nice to have: you're proficient with Webflow.
  • You're based full-time in either Columbus, Ohio or New York, NY

Why you'll love working at Lower:

  • You'll be surrounded in-office by talented, dedicated people who believe in the company's mission.
  • You'll be able to shape the future of Lower's user experience.
  • You'll join a locally and nationally recognized best place to work that values promotion from within.
  • Plus:
    • Competitive compensation plan
    • Extended benefit offerings including:
      • Medical/dental/vision
      • Paid holidays
      • Paid time off
    • Parental leave
    • Life insurance
    • Short- and long-term disability
    • 401K with company match
    • Discount on home mortgage refinances or purchase

Salary Range: $95,000 - $115,000

Lower provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Privacy Policy
